admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
subsc: General finance sector,Health,Other social services,General industry and trade sector,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Credit (SAC)
            Project for Tajikistan aims to support the government's
            efforts to 1) restore macroeconomic stability by providing
            foreign exchange; 2) privatize state-owned enterprises; 3)
            promote an efficient banking system; and 4) enhance
            budgetary provisions for health, education, and the social
            safety net. The first of three components privatizes all
            small-scale enterprises; converts all large enterprises into
            joint stock companies and registers their shares with the
            finance ministry; sells or scraps state-owned trucks;
            privatizes state-owned cotton ginneries, strengthens the
            legal basis and enforcement capacity to foster competition,
            and monitors newly privatized gins; dissolves the Republican
            Corporation of Pakhtek Tajik, sells its assets, and
            transfers supervision of seed production and cotton grading
            functions to the Ministry of Agriculture; and prepares and
            privatizes an aluminum plant. The project's financial
            sector reform improves the legal framework for banking
            activities; upgrades the regulatory framework and
            supervision capacity; and restructures individual banks,
            focusing on the five largest. To bolster the social sector,
            the government is expected to ensure timely payments of
            salaries, pensions, and safety net payments; eliminate
            outstanding arrears in the state budget; and review the
            expenditure composition for 1999 in the social sectors,
            agreeing to budget allocations and the plan to restructure
            the social protection system.
